title: History of present illness
content: The patient reports ongoing knee pain that has been fluctuating in location, with current discomfort localized to the right knee. The pain began two weeks ago while the patient was in bed, at which time the entire knee was painful. The patient notes that the pain has since shifted and is now primarily felt in the right knee when reaching out to that side. The patient acknowledges having arthritis, which the provider confirms is likely responsible for the migratory nature of the pain. The patient denies any recent trauma or specific inciting events. The pain has not significantly impacted daily activities beyond discomfort during movement. No prior treatments or remedies were discussed.
